meanings.definition: To suffer a continuous, dull pain
meanings.sent1: After playing soccer all day, my body aches from head to toe.
meanings.sent2: She aches for her lost dog and hopes it will return soon.
meanings.sent3: The old chair aches with every creak as if it's telling a story.
meanings.sent4: His heart aches with longing for the distant stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The lonely tree aches for the touch of the warm sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The constant ache in her back made it hard to sit for long periods.
meanings.sent2: He felt a dull ache in his chest after running for miles.
meanings.sent3: The ache in his tooth was so annoying that he couldn't focus on his work.
meanings.sent4: The ache in her muscles reminded her of the hard work she had done.
meanings.sent5: The ache in his joints was a reminder of the rainy weather outside.
